title: Gordon Shillinglaw at Colombia and George Staubus at Berkeley had articulated activity-based concepts by the early 1960s. Also in the early 1960s, General Electric accountants may have been the first to use the term activity to describe work that causes costs. However, the process of codifying the concept to what ABC is best known for today is mainly attributable to Robin Cooper at the Harvard Business School
